title: Sans serif with rounded m, r, with no spurs, similar to Helvetica and Century Gothic
content:
As stated in the subject, and shown in the attachment:  
Sans serif with rounded m, r, with no spurs, similarities to Helvetica and Century Gothic.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415235721im_/http:/typophile.com/files/photo_5249.jpg)

I can't show the original photo of the font as seen in the wild, for client confidentiality reasons.

The lower-case M is definitely a heavier weight than the other characters, that's not just "how it looks."

While it appears to be a mashup of different type faces, I assure you, from what I've seen, it's an actual font with at least 2 weights.

Font: 

 No

author: PumiceT

comments.content: Add ITC Ronda to the list of similar fonts.
Mixing the different [Chalet](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415235721/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/chalet) should get you pretty close.
